knimeNode.name: Primary Forecasting
knimeNode.shortDescription: Forecast bacterial concentration based on previously estimated primary models.

fullDescription.intro: This node uses primary models from the database to predict the bacterial concentration (log10 cfu per gram or per ml) at the given test conditions. The specified model, together with the estimated values, can take specified input variables and generate predictions, i.e. estimates for the response variables.

ports.inPort: A table array from the properly configured "LoadRelatedData" node, merged via the Table Array Merger with a table of input values created by the Table Creator node (which is part of the basic KNIME installation, not this BfR plugin). Place the Table Creator separately from the existing workflow. In the config dialog enter the desired points of time in one column of the empty table. Double click the column's heading and set the column type to "Double" instead of "String". Now connect the Table Creator's output and the Load Related Data's output with the Table Array Merger's input.
ports.outPort: A table array consisting of only one table, which contains the user-specified times (input variables) as well as the predicted values for each specified model. This table can be extracted with an appended Table Array Splitter node.
